title: I wish riot would just talk to us
body:
Like, its one thing to make a garbage meta like this one, its another thing to be completely silent on the matter and leave your playerbase in the dark.

I just wish Riot would speak to us on the issue. That post asking for Riot to respond to us about TTK (time to kill)/damage creep, snowballing and gamelength got like 200+ upvotes and was the front page for like 2 days and nothing. Silence.

{{sticker:sg-janna}}

Edit: guys, i meant riot isnt talking to us about the stuff that i listed above. not just "talking to us" in general. please stop telling me that the red tracker exists or that a rioter responded to x thread a few days ago, or stuff like meddlers gameplay thoughts.

A lot of rioters prefer to write up their thoughts on bigger topics into [dev corner](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner) threads rather than responding to specific posts. This helps us get comments to a bigger audience (if a rioter arrives late to the party on a thread, very few players get to see their response), and also means we can translate the thread so we can reach players around the world as well. 

I’m a big fan of [Meddler’s quick gameplay thoughts](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/iQfa47rE-quick-gameplay-thoughts-july-20), which he tries to do 2-3 times a week. He usually sticks around to answer questions for a bit afterwards. Often we’ll prefer to wait until we have something meaningful to say, but if you feel like there’s an important topic being ignored, let us know.

[Maple Nectar just posted a longer deep dive on snowballing and game length](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/gnOFYO6O-touching-base-on-mid-season-marksman-and-snowballing) over in dev corner as well, I’m not sure if it answers your specific concerns, but hopefully shares a bit more detail.

Purely speculating here but it's probably internal data showing average damage isn't much higher than previously it's just player perception changes or defense has dropped while damage has stayed relatively the same. Or it could be that riot likes the current damage that certain classes puts out and saying they have no plans to change that would make boards go into full rage mode. They could be drawing straws for a scapegoat.
If they have no plans for change for defense to come back, this will be my last season. I get too angry playing all the time. It isn't fun to instantly kill the enemy, or get instantly killed.

The problem with these formats is that it isn't Riot talking _with_ the playerbase, it's Rioters talking _at_ players. Your very comment on here talks about prioritizing a larger immediate audience over direct responses, and that's a fundamental difference relative to Riot's older communications, one that has turned a lot of players off. There aren't many real conversations going on here, particularly since certain particular topics are very clearly avoided, despite player insistence on the matter. If you were to take the time to respond directly to individual posts more often, I can guarantee you that those replies would find their way to a much larger audience, particularly since there are features like the Red Tracker, plus sites like S@20 that catalogue these replies meticulously.

> The problem with these formats is that it isn't Riot talking with the playerbase, it's Rioters talking at players. 

I could honestly write a whole thread on the topic.

Often we’ll prefer to wait until we have something meaningful to say, but if you feel like there’s an important topic being ignored, let us know.

This does lend itself to showing an interest in player thoughts or open lines of communication.
There was one guy who posted the same question for 2 months in those first 5 pages, and was passed over every time before finally giving up... I don't believe Meddler didn't notice him, so what are we to think? 


> [Maple Nectar just posted a longer deep dive on snowballing and game length](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/gnOFYO6O-touching-base-on-mid-season-marksman-and-snowballing) over in dev corner as well, I’m not sure if it answers your specific concerns, but hopefully shares a bit more detail.

I'm hoping to hear more from Maple, and maybe we could even see some of the other devs working alongside Meddler offering him support but aiding him in answering his posts. If just 5 or 6 of them too 5 or 6 pages each it would go a long way in mending communications.

That‘s OK for me.

But „outside gameplay topics“ the activity of Riot is really low.
Since over 4 months there is no response from the questions that several players asked about the Ahri statue. They even don‘t know if the responsible staff read that feedback.

If you regularly check the dev corner and red tracker there is all there responses and posts. You'll see that there are post done ever 2-5 days where they will answer any question you have about anything as long as they get to your question.

I was there ~5 minutes after Meddler's post and I asked something like "Is there any plan to even consider lowering damage and buffing towers". My question was the only that got skipped out of the first 15 minutes of questions, I highly doubt that was coincidental. Not to mention the dozens of other posts saying the exact same thing that get ignored every single day.
Its not a question of substance nor measure. "Lowering the damage" and "buffing towers" means pretty much nothing other than showing a gross misunderstanding of what balance is and requires.

It was a generalized question that could easily be answered with "Yes we are looking into this, but no promises on a timeframe" or "No, we believe the current pacing of the game is appropriate". I didn't want to hit them with a 5 paragraph essay because Meddler simply isn't going to answer that in the dev corner.

> pretty much nothing other than showing a gross misunderstanding of what balance is and requires.

As for that part, I'm part of the .1% that has actually played with challengers/pro players. So forgive me, but maybe you should keep your idea of "what balance is and requires" in your aram/bot games.
Congratulations, doesnt mean you know how to balance.

Perhaps not, but what it _does_ mean is that they are in a much better position than you to talk about the game's current state, and that you are in absolutely no place to lecture anyone else on "what balance is and requires". You lost this argument _hard_, so it may be in your best interest to stop digging yourself a bigger hole.

He knows a shit ton more about the game than you do. This is a fact, and you can't argue against it.

As a matter of fact, I'm part of that group who's played with/against pros as well.

Rank is not everything, but it _is_ a good guideline and indicator.
Which, again, means nothing when it comes to how to balance the game.

Experience directly translates into a better understanding of the game's mechanics and fundamentals. Understanding the game's fundamentals and mechanics yields you information on how to better balance said game via various options.

The better players you face, the faster you gain experience.

Now crawl back under your rock, troll.

Lol, no. Understanding and playing a game and designing and balancing a game are two completely different skillsets with almost 0 correlation. Knowing what the most optimal strat is and the best way to eek out damage and map control has nothing in common with knowing why that is or how to best change things for all ELOs and make a better experience for most players. Its like saying a professional taste tester is automatically a great chef just because theyve tasted the best food.
Did you seriously just compare cooking to video game designing?

> Is there any plan to **even consider** lowering damage and buffing towers

The highlighted portion isn't really nessecary, and only serves to make your question less likely to get an answer. I'm not a expert, but it adds a tone to the question that just makes it sound, well, hostile. You're asking for a change, as opposed to getting Meddlr's opinion on the two subjects on hand. 

A better way to phrase it, if you really wanted to get an answer, is in a way that just asks for his view, not for what you want to see changed. 

"Are you satisfied with the state of towers in the game? What's your opinion on what a Tower's purpose is for? Do you think it's possible to buff towers without lengthening the game time, as that's something you've stated you're satisfied with?"

As I stated above I was trying to give them the ability to give an easy/generalized answer. I didn’t lock them into a solid yes/no and simply wanted a “yes we have talked about possibly doing something” or a “no we are prioritizing other projects at the moment”. My tone was not hostile (or at least not meant to be), if anything I was giving them quite a softball question on an issue that they’ve ignored.

I agree with this. The problem at this point is that it feels like this lack of communication is deliberate: we do get Rioters on here, but they mostly just say what they were already going to do, and very clearly avoid certain questions and topics. There's no dialogue in place, nor do the developers seem to be taking in feedback from most players at this point. Others have mentioned it here, but it feels like part of this may be that Riot is taking a direction that is sure to anger us, and don't feel like explaining themselves for fear of getting yelled at. In the end, it all boils down to the same, but it's still not a great tactic, as this radio silence has severely damaged the relationship between Riot and their playerbase. Actions speak louder than words, and considering how we've had zero words from Riot on time-to-kill, yet plenty of damage increases, I think it's safe to assume that the developers are continuing to push for exactly the direction the community hates so much, no matter what.
This is such bs. When will reality hit them that they’re killing their game?

Everytime there is a new thread in the Dev Corner section I ask about the damage creep, but I just get ignored or thumbed down by casuals who think one-shot kills are "wai too kewl". Honestly, if we want something to happen, we have to be vocal and seek a response. I suggest that those who want a response actively ask them in Dev Corner as I have.
